briefTitle: Mid-point Transverse Process to Pleura Block for Breast Cancer Surgery: A Randomized Controlled Trial
officialTitle: Analgesic Benefits of the Novel Mid-point Transverse Process to Pleura (MTP) Block for Ambulatory Breast Cancer Surgery: A Randomized Controlled Trial
primaryOutcomeMeasure: Postoperative analgesia during the first 24 hours.
eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* English or French Speaking
* Scheduled for major breast surgery
* ASA physical status classification I-III
* BMI \<30kg/m2

Exclusion Criteria:

* Prior ipsilateral breast surgery
* Pre-existing neurological deficit or peripheral neuropathy involving the ipsilateral chest
* Contraindications to regional anesthesia
* Patient refusal of regional technique
* Chronic pain disorder
* Chronic opioid use
* Inability to provide informed consent
